column4: hi, i'm having trouble starting X in dapper drake (botting as a live CD) - i can get Knoppix 3.8 to start x with no problems. is there a config file or something that i can copy from my live knoppix session that will have the correct settings for x in ubuntu?
what kind of card do you have?
Saphire x800 GTO
can you get to a command line with the cd?
i had a look for xorg.conf in /etc/X11/ but it's not there
- yes, i have cmd prompt
go with the command "dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" and the first will make you choose a driver.  Scroll down and select "vesa"
- I've tried manually editing xorg.conf and using vesa - my screens go to sleep and pc locks up when i try to startx
thats what my X800 did until I used the xserver-xorg command.  Manually didn't work for m
*me
i was just hoping that i would somehow be able to grab the settings that knoppix uses and use them for ubuntu
ahh, k
thanks i'll give it a try
no prob, best of luck hope it helps
- have you got it working with the fglrx driver? or only vesa?
either is ok for me at the moment, i just want to be able to start x ;)
thats why I'm in here, I've got a problem with my custom kernel headers and my fglrx install.  I need someone to look at the output
but it worked before
ahh, k
anyone got time to look at my output from fglrx install? http://pastebin.com/769482 is where the error is.
did you get it working?
